subject: Another eclipse voice
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
They seemed to be louder than usual, but not as frequent as usual. That's
how this works, you're hearing short bits of broadcasts, then there's a
coherent string of words, usually there is some distortion, as in the word
girl--gir-url. Isn't that called a broad reach in sailing? =:-O

F-S

They seemed o be loude han usual, bu no as equen as usual. Tha 's how his wo ks, you' e hea ing sho bi s o b oadcas s, hen he e's a cohe en s ing o wo ds, usually he e is some dis o ion, as in he wo d gi l--gi -u l. Isn' ha called a b oad each in sailing? =:-O

Â 
F-S
